meanings.sent1: The rabbit tried to outtrot the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The horse outtrotted all the other animals in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cheetah challenged the snail to outtrot it in a friendly race.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outtrot her own record time in the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination to outtrot the competition was admirable.

meanings.sent1: The farmer would outtrot his horses every morning for exercise.
meanings.sent2: She would outtrot her favorite pony in the field every day.
meanings.sent3: The dog would outtrot its tricks whenever guests came over.
meanings.sent4: The children would outtrot their toys to play with them outside.
meanings.sent5: The team would outtrot their best strategies during the crucial match.
